DataElement.preferredName: Biopsy Obtain Purpose Clinical Trial Screening Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes no indicator related to a biopsy obtained for purposes of use on MATCH.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biopsy Obtain Purpose Clinical Trial Screening
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._To come into possession of something._What something is used for; reason or intention._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._A systematic examination or assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: To come into possession of something.:What something is used for; reason or intention.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:A systematic examination or assessment.

Concepts.definition: To come into possession of something.
What something is used for; reason or intention.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
